intro: Chirita rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leafed chireta, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or rocky crevices. Its leaves are usually thick and succulent, adapted to retain moisture in its native habitat. The flowers, which are often brightly colored, attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
